definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: Also, It can give buddhist a place to gather.
sentences.chinese: 并且，它可能给佛教徒地方会集。

sentences.english: The pupils assembled [were assembled] in the school hall.
The upcoming G-20 Summit draws the key national leaders together.
sentences.chinese: 即将召开的20国峰会让关键国家的领导人会集一堂。

definition: to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
to flock/to swarm/to congregate en masse/to cluster together
to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
variant of 糾合|纠合[jiu1 he2]
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize
